title: Report: UK practice locker room to receive $4 million upgrade
text:
Manage Report: UK practice locker room to receive $4 million upgrade Kentucky basketball's locker room at the Joe Craft Center practice facility will receive a $4 million upgrade, according to a report from The Lexington Herald-Leader. Slot to Kentucky Links (Photo: Mark Zerof, USA TODAY Sports) 
Kentucky basketball's locker room at the Joe Craft Center practice facility will receive a $4 million upgrade, according to a Friday report from The Lexington Herald-Leader . 
The proposal was approved by the UK Board of Trustees athletics committee Friday morning and is expected to be approved by the full board Friday afternoon. 
Get the latest UK news sent straight to your inbox with out EMAIL NEWSLETTER 
According to the proposal, the upgrades will serve to "renovate and improve the existing player locker and shower space, lounge area, and team meeting room into one multi-functional space" and will also include a "supplementation and nutrition fueling station, as well as a hydration station." 
The project will be paid for by private donors, led by a $1.5 million gift from UK alumnus Davis Marksbury. 
The Joe Craft Center opened in January of 2007 and was built onto the back of Memorial Coliseum, which was built in 1950. 
The Wildcats' locker room at Rupp Arena received a $3.1 million upgrade in 2013. 
In a recent interview with USA Today , one-time Kentucky recruit and Oklahoma commit Trae Young and his mother said UK had the worst athletic dorms of the schools they were considering. 
"They've got the worst dorms out of all the schools," Young's mother said. "You've gotta live there for nine months. I mean, come on now, it was one room, the sink was in the bedroom; definitely traditional old school dorm room." 
Wildcat Coal Lodge opened in 2012 and received a budget request of $21 million for renovations in January of 2016.
